result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronda Jane Langer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit, Huber Privileges and 10 days time served credit as to each of the two counts.

Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 1 year, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond posted as to Waushara Co Case No. 2015CM000352 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Any residence where the Defendant lives is to be free of any alcohol.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with Richard O'Kon and/or Raona O'Kon, unless contact is specifically authorized by the supervising agent.
Defendant must follow through with any grief counseling and/or therapy as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: Cases Called @ 11:20 AM: Defendant Ronda Jane Langer in court with attorney Amanda Bellville and Atty J. Steven Heil.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Global resolution recited by ADA with argued terms on sentencing.  Def and Atty Heil confirm recital.  Atty Belville moves for withdrawal as Atty Heil will be assuming her representation.  Def agrees with withdrawal.  Court grants Atty Belville to withdraw at this time.  16CM-83:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per Atty Heil - matter will be resolved with a NC plea today.     Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  One victim present which will wish to speak at the appropriate time.  16CM-83 - Plea Ct Nos 1 and 2:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  15CM-219 and 15CM-352 both DRI.   Statement by Victim J. Seegert.  Argument by ADA.  Argument by Atty Heil.  Statement by Def: Yes.  The Court:   Ct 1 - 6 mos WCJ - I/S.  Ct 2: 6 mos WCJ I/S consecutive to each other - S/W 2 yrs probation.  May petition for early termination of supervision if joined by agent at any time after completion of 1 yr.  Conditions:  Complete an AODA and any follow thru as deemed appropriate;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; the residence of where Def lives is to be free of any alcohol; follow thru with any grief counseling and/or therapy as agent deems appropriate; Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court; no contact with Richard Okon and/or Raona Okon unless specifically authorized by supervising agent.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.  10 days TS credit as to each of the two counts in the event of any revocation.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Attorney Szilagyi and Ronda Langer appeared by video

1:14 pm case called. Defendant Ronda Jane Langer in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Ronda Jane Langer in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.
